channel.title: Os X on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in Os X on My New Hugo Site

item.title: How to open a Terminal tab programatically
item.description: Open a Terminal tab programatically in Node.js. index.js: var exec = require('child_process').exec; var through = require('through'); var os = require('os'); var child; var args = process.argv; function openTab(cmd, cb) { if (os.platform() !== 'darwin') { throw new Error('No support for this operating system but feel free to fork the repo and add it :)'); } var open = ['osascript -e \'tell application "Terminal" to activate\' ', '-e \'tell application "System Events" to tell process "Terminal" to keystroke "t"', 'using command down\' ', '-e \'tell application "Terminal" to do script', '"', cmd, '"', 'in selected tab of the front window\''].
